intro: Spicantopsis niponica, commonly known as the Japanese spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features slender, grass-like stems that are typically green or reddish in color. Its flowers are small and clustered in spike-like inflorescences, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. Spicantopsis niponica is often found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks.
